alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 03 at 7:21PM PDT until April 04 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 29 to 35 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Areas below 2000 feet including Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County, Northern and Central Sacramento Valley, Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County and Northeast Foothills. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 9 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lingering breezy conditions along the western Sacramento Valley may moderate temperatures overnight there, but wind-sheltered areas could still see frost. Elsewhere, cold temperatures Tuesday morning will allow for area of frost. Cold morning lows are also forecast for Wednesday morning but not as cold as Tuesday.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County
